page.title: 03Colvend: Clubs
page.content: The Carpet Bowling Club meets every Monday in the winter.While the annual membership fee is Â£1,everyone pays 10p each night and this becomes the prize money.The winners get part of the money and the runners-up get the rest. You can play with a partner or on your own.You roll your bowls up a long board with rings at the end like a target.You have to try to get your bowls nearest to the middle. The Women's Rural Institute,or the W.R.I., meets in Colvend Church hall once a month.They do crafts like knitting,sewing or baking.They talk about serious matters to do with the countryside. The Woman's Guild also meets monthly but it is attached to the Church. They have speakers talking about missionary work and church affairs and raise money for the Church.
